author: Jonathan Cheng
title: A Look at South Korea’s Top Spy and Negotiator With North
text:
SEOUL—At a dinner hosted by North Korean leader Kim Jong Un for a delegation from the South this week, a bespectacled official leaned forward to talk to a grinning Mr. Kim—a scene captured in a photograph displayed prominently in the North’s largest newspaper.
That man, Suh Hoon, is South Korea’s top spy, tasked with running espionage operations targeting the North and analyzing intelligence on potential threats. For years he has also played a central role in behind-the-scenes diplomatic outreach to Pyongyang and its autocratic... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
